content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

All retail is closed in general.

Only shops carrying essential goods -mainly: pharmacies, grocery stores, drugstores, pet stores, opticians, newsagents, e-shop and Zásilkovna pickup points, laundromats and drycleaners, towing services and carwashes, gas stations, gardening shops, florists, mobile, computer and technical services, locksmiths, hardware stores, household goods, funeral homes.

The shops that are allowed to stay open will be open Monday to Saturday 5:00-20:00. On Sundays they must be CLOSED. Only gas stations, pharmacies, shops at airports and train stations and shops at medical facilities are allowed to be open on Sundays.

All shops that are not listed as exemptions have to be closed. Such as clothes and shoe shops, bookstores, jewelry shops, stationery shops, hobby markets, shops selling furniture and flooring and shops selling electronics.

If you go shopping, follow the hygienic rules (Hygiene section). For the whole duration of shopping, it is necessary to wear a mask and to social distance (especially when waiting in a queue). Before entering the shop, disinfect your hands, and repeat after returning home. For more protection, shopping in gloves can be recommended. Don't touch any surfaces unnecessarily and use gloves when picking out fruit, vegetables or baked goods.

If you are part of a higher risk group or are in quarantine (isolation), ask a neighbor, relative or friend to do your shopping. If this isn't possible, you can reach out to volunteers. Help and deliveries to high risk groups and the infected), who will be happy to help. You can also order online and get your shopping delivered to your doorstep.

Shopping centers can only be entered in groups of 2. The exemption being children under 15 accompanied by an adult from the same household (typically parents, grandparents or siblings living with the child).

Try to shop online. If you enter a shop, follow all hygienic measures, social distance and pay by card. We have to shop but it is a place where we encounter a lot of people, so please, be responsible. You are protecting yourself and others.

questions_answers.question: When are shops open?
questions_answers.value: Monday to Saturday, from 5:00 to 20:00 (this only applies to the shops on the list of exceptions).

questions_answers.question: Can shops be open on Sunday?
questions_answers.value: No, the exceptions are gas stations or shops at the airport and train stations and shops in medical facilities.

questions_answers.question: Are shops open during public holidays?
questions_answers.value: Yes, during the state of emergency the mandatory closing on public holidays does not apply.

questions_answers.question: Can senior citizens go shopping?
questions_answers.value: Yes, the measures from spring sectioning out a time for the senior citizens to shop does not apply now.

questions_answers.question: Can I pay in cash?
questions_answers.value: Yes, but it is recommended to pay contactlessly (by card).

questions_answers.question: Are shopping centres open?
questions_answers.value: Yes, but within them only shops carrying essentials (especially food, drugstores and pharmacies) can stay open.

questions_answers.question: Why is the Wi-Fi turned off in shopping centres?
questions_answers.value: The goal is to limit the amount of people in public spaces. Because people would stay in malls because of the free Wi-Fi, it was ordered to temporarily switch off the Wi-Fi connection.

questions_answers.question: How should I go shopping if I have the coronavirus?
questions_answers.value: If you are in quarantine or isolation, you can't go shopping. You can shop online, pay by transfer and have the shopping delivered to your doorstep. You can also ask a friend, neighbor or relative to do your shopping for you.

questions_answers.question: What if there aren't any deliveries available in a village?
questions_answers.value: Reach out to your friends, family or neighbors.

questions_answers.question: What hygienic rules do I have to follow?
questions_answers.value: Wear your mask, social distance and disinfect your hands. Disinfectant must be free to use for employees and customers and the door handles, railings, shopping carts and any open surfaces must be routinely disinfected.

questions_answers.question: Do I have to shop in gloves?
questions_answers.value: No, but single use gloves (or any similar means to protect your hands) have to be available for free in shops for customers to use.

questions_answers.question: Is it possible to try on clothes in a shop?
questions_answers.value: The clothing stores are closed at this time. When they reopen, it will be possible to try on clothes after disinfecting your hands.

questions_answers.question: Under what conditions will shops be able to sell returned clothes?
questions_answers.value: Only after the clothes have been kept separately from the other merchandise for 24 hours.

questions_answers.question: Can my shop have a dispensing window?
questions_answers.value: Yes, it isn't necessary to use a courier company; each shop can dispense its products on its own. It is also possible to deliver to your customers’ homes.

questions_answers.question: Do I have to register sales in EET?
questions_answers.value: No, the registry has been stopped until the end of 2022.

questions_answers.question: Does the sales ban apply to shopping for business owners?
questions_answers.value: No, shops related to business ownership are allowed to stay open.

questions_answers.question: How can I prove that I'm a business owner?
questions_answers.value: The best thing is to have a copy of your trade license (usually a picture of it on your phone should be enough). You can also tell them your IČO (company identification number) which the shop can then verify in the state database. One person can enter using one IČO.

questions_answers.question: Can an employee enter instead of the business owner?
questions_answers.value: Yes, but they have to have a proxy (does not have to be officially verified) and know the IČO.

questions_answers.question: Are florists open?
questions_answers.value: Yes, but only two people can enter at a time.

questions_answers.question: Are shops with furniture open?
questions_answers.value: No, shops selling furniture and flooring are not open (as they are not considered household goods).

questions_answers.question: Are pharmacies open?
questions_answers.value: Yes, and they are allowed to be open on Sunday as well.

questions_answers.question: Are stationery shops open?
questions_answers.value: No.

questions_answers.question: Are jewelers open?
questions_answers.value: No.

questions_answers.question: Are libraries open?
questions_answers.value: No.

questions_answers.question: Are casinos open?
questions_answers.value: No.

questions_answers.question: Are banks open?
questions_answers.value: Yes.

questions_answers.question: Are clothing shops open?
questions_answers.value: No, they are not on the list of exceptions so they have to stay closed. But you can order clothes online.

questions_answers.question: Are shoe shops open?
questions_answers.value: No, they are not on the list of exceptions so they have to stay closed. But you can order shoes online.

questions_answers.question: Are electronics repair shops open?
questions_answers.value: Yes.

questions_answers.question: Are hobby markets open to the public?
questions_answers.value: No.

questions_answers.question: Are hobby markets open for business owners?
questions_answers.value: Yes, the ban does not apply to companies and tradespeople. When entering the shop you have to verify yourself by IČO and wear a mask the whole time.

questions_answers.question: Can garden centers be open?
questions_answers.value: Yes they can, Monday to Saturday, from 6:00 to 20:00. This also applies to garden centers within hobby markets.

questions_answers.question: What if I have to return merchandise, but the shop is closed due to Covid-19?
questions_answers.value: You can't physically enter the shop. But your consumer rights are preserved (https://www.coi.cz/prava-spotrebitelu-v-dobe-nouzoveho-stavu/). We recommend reaching out to the specific seller and agreeing on a process with them.
